summary: Frontend testing completed for Happy Place Coffee Menu UX redesign. All core features working: tile grid layout, drink detail page, size selection, customization options, cart functionality, edit mode, and responsive design.
test_credentials: None required - all data is MOCKED via /app/frontend/src/data/mock.js
context_for_next_testing_agent: All drink menu UX redesign features tested and working. Key test results: 1) Menu page loads with tile grid layout (36 drink tiles), 2) Tiles show only image, name, calories (no add to cart button on tiles), 3) Grid is responsive: 2 cols mobile, 3 cols sm, 4 cols md/lg, 5 cols xl, 6 cols 2xl, 4) Clicking tile navigates to /menu/drinks/:slug, 5) Drink detail page shows large image, name, description, calories, price, 6) Size selection with 3 mug icons (S/M/L) updates calories and price correctly, 7) Customization options show for drinks with hasCustomization=true (Latte shows milk, syrups, sauces, shots, add-ons, toppings), 8) Non-customizable drinks (Cold Brew) only show Special Instructions, 9) Quantity +/- controls work, 10) Special instructions field with 150 char limit enforced, 11) Add to Order button adds item to cart and returns to /menu, 12) Cart shows added items correctly with item count badge, 13) Clicking cart item navigates to detail page with ?edit=cartKey parameter, 14) Edit mode shows 'Update Order' button instead of 'Add to Order', 15) Customized indicator shows when drink differs from default, 16) Reset to Default button clears all customizations, 17) After Update Order, returns to /menu, 18) Sidebar category navigation scrolls to sections, 19) Breakfast and Dinner links work correctly, 20) Mobile view shows category pills and Breakfast/Dinner buttons

features_tested.feature: Menu page loads at /menu with tile grid
Tiles show image, name, calories only (no add to cart)
Grid responsive: 2-6 columns based on viewport
Drink detail shows large image, name, description
Size selection updates price and calories
Non-customizable drinks show only Special Instructions
Add to Order adds item to cart
Clicking cart item opens edit mode with ?edit=cartKey
Edit mode shows Update Order button
Update Order updates cart and returns to /menu
Sidebar category navigation scrolls to sections
Back to Drink Menu link works

mocked_api_note: ALL DATA IS MOCKED via /app/frontend/src/data/mock.js - no backend API calls
